title: bent charger port frame macbook pro
message:
I have this 2011 MBP that was dropped on the charger port area so now it's bent and damaged on that area. The magsafe board needed to be replaced but I can not fit the new one into the port where it can charge properly.

Does anyone know a good way I can try to bend the aluminum frame so the magsafe can fit properly without badly damaging the frame?

Here are some images: [url]https://www.dropbox.com/sh/ponngv33heu5h0d/AACs7QXyEYSI_Fb1DY-XiMjoa?dl=0[/url]

title: bent charger port frame macbook pro
message: Needle-nosed pliers, and wrap the frame in a t-shirt or cloth several times. Also, the casing on the 2011 pros is actually quite soft...you can bend it with just your hands (unlike the newer models or the Airs).

title: bent charger port frame macbook pro
message:
I tried your suggestion but I still am not able to get in that small area to bend it in place.
Is there anything else I can try to get it to bend easily like putting heat on the aluminum?

Is there a small tool I can use to file the aluminum?
